page.title: 01Hebden Bridge & Hebden Royd
page.content: {HEBDEN BRIDGE,}West Yorkshire. The population of Hebden bridge and Heptonstall is approx. 4300 (Hebden Royd 8,700). It is situated centrally North-South and East-West in the Pennine Chain at the Confluence of the rivers Hebden and Calder. Steep-sided valleys have influenced the local{architecture,}producing houses of four stories built into the hillside. The lower house was entered at the front with the upper house entered two stories higher at the rear. A feature of this area is accessible {countryside,}woods, moors and farmlands, and a rich diversity of wildlife. {Industry}used to be based round textiles; fustians, cords and moleskins and woolens and worsteds. Nowadays more diversity, esp.{tourism
